channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ceasefire goes into effect in Gaza, Israel says, after initial delay
item.description: The Israeli government announced the ceasefire with Hamas would take effect at 11:15 local time, nearly three hours after the originally scheduled time for hostilities to cease.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli government announced the ceasefire with Hamas would take effect at 11:15 local time, nearly three hours after the originally scheduled time for hostilities to cease.

(Image credit: Bashar Taleb)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Steve Bannon says MAGA populism will win — as Trump is surrounded by billionaires
item.description: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon says he doesn't believe the president-elect will listen to "tech oligarchs" over the right-wing populist movement that helped him secure another White House term.
item.content:encoded: Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon says he doesn't believe the president-elect will listen to "tech oligarchs" over the right-wing populist movement that helped him secure another White House term.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Many doctors don't discuss sex after cancer. But survivors wish they would
item.description: Questions about sex and intimacy often go unanswered for people with cancer. It's a glaring problem, especially for the growing number of young people being diagnosed.
item.content:encoded:
Questions about sex and intimacy often go unanswered for people with cancer. It's a glaring problem, especially for the growing number of young people being diagnosed.

(Image credit: ‎)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Cleaning up after the LA wildfires is dangerous. Here's how to protect yourself
item.description: The ash and debris created during the burns could be loaded with dangerous materials. Experts suggest taking care.
item.content:encoded:
The ash and debris created during the burns could be loaded with dangerous materials. Experts suggest taking care.

(Image credit: DAVID PASHAEE/Middle East Images/AFP via Getty)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: 33 hostages are expected to be released by Hamas as part of a ceasefire with Israel
item.description: There are men, women and children on the list of 33 to be released from Gaza. Two are U.S. citizens. Israel is set to free hundreds of prisoners in exchange for them.
item.content:encoded: There are men, women and children on the list of 33 to be released from Gaza. Two are U.S. citizens. Israel is set to free hundreds of prisoners in exchange for them.
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Trump's 2nd term represents hope for the right and fear of a dark era for others
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration comes at a pivotal time in American history. Insulated from controversy, Trump will enter the White House more prepared than when he first won in 2016.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration comes at a pivotal time in American history. Insulated from controversy, Trump will enter the White House more prepared than when he first won in 2016.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: This Virginia program helps former foster youth get degrees, at any age
item.description: Great Expectations was designed to help people who grew up in foster care get their two-year degrees. And unlike many programs for former foster youth, there are no age limits.
item.content:encoded:
Great Expectations was designed to help people who grew up in foster care get their two-year degrees. And unlike many programs for former foster youth, there are no age limits.

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Megan Pauly

item.title: Gaza ceasefire begins after delay as Hamas names hostages to be released Sunday
item.description: A long-awaited ceasefire in Gaza began after a three-hour delay as Hamas named the three female hostages it plans to free later on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
A long-awaited ceasefire in Gaza began after a three-hour delay as Hamas named the three female hostages it plans to free later on Sunday.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Deadline passes without Gaza ceasefire going into effect
item.description: The deadline for the start of a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip passed as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Hamas had provided the names of the three hostages it was set to release on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
The deadline for the start of a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip passed as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Hamas had provided the names of the three hostages it was set to release on Sunday.

(Image credit: Oded Balilty)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Outgoing Interior Secretary Deb Haaland hands off closer ties with Indian Country
item.description: Deb Haaland, the country's first indigenous cabinet secretary, used her term at the Interior Department to make what activists say is irreversible impact in recognizing the painful history of the government's treatment Native Americans
item.content:encoded: Deb Haaland, the country's first indigenous cabinet secretary, used her term at the Interior Department to make what activists say is irreversible impact in recognizing the painful history of the government's treatment Native Americans
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler
